page.title: 06LIFESTYLE
page.content: {A day in the life of the vicar. } I am usually up by 6a.m. so that I can be in church for prayers by 6.45a.m. I say mattins each morning and celebrate Holy Communion most days. Back home again I have breakfast and after that in my study studying preparing sermons and talks, writing letters and seeing people who want to see me. On two mornings each week I go out with sick Communions taking the Blessed Sacrament to old and sick people who are unable to come to church. I spend all of my afternoons visiting either in hospital or to homes in the parish. I get back to church for Evensong at 5p.m. and then go home for tea. In the evenings I have meetings or to prepare people for marriage or baptism services.I try to watch the news on T.V.at10p.m.Then night prayers and so to bed by 11p.m.
